meanings.definition: Torahs: plural of Torah, the first five books of the Hebrew Bible
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi read from the torahs to teach us about our history.
meanings.sent2: The torahs are considered sacred texts in the Jewish faith.
meanings.sent3: At the synagogue, the children playfully pretended the torahs were magical scrolls.
meanings.sent4: The torahs are like ancient guides, leading us through the stories of our ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The intricate designs on the torahs made them even more captivating.

meanings.definition: Torahs: multiple scrolls containing the text of the Torah, used in Jewish religious services
meanings.sent1: The torahs were carefully carried into the synagogue for the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday, the community gathered around the torahs to pray together.
meanings.sent3: As the wind blew, the torahs seemed to dance in their ornate covers.
meanings.sent4: The torahs stood tall like guardians of ancient wisdom in the temple.
meanings.sent5: The golden decorations on the torahs shimmered in the candlelight.
